availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hines Ogden (Webster county, kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Wesley Ogden and Elizabeth Chenault Ogden. Married to Lucy Finch Ogden in 1837. Father of John W. Ogden, Ann C. Ogden, Edward Ogden, William Ogden, and Benjamin Ogden. Farmer in Davidson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Davidson County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, District 21, p. 363A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, District 21, p. 611.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 473.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 480A.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, Ky, National #94527, State #1243.
"William Hines Ogden (1816-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial #93730825, accessed October 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93730825.
